Problem[edit]

How many odd and even divisors of are there?

Solution[edit]

We start by factoring the expression. If a divisor is even, then the exponent of the of the divisor’s prime factorization is at least , so there are even divisors.

If a divisor is odd, then the exponent of the of the divisor’s prime factorization is , so there are odd divisors.

Problem[edit]

A trough, if filled with cold water tap, will be full in 14 minutes. To empty the full trough with opening the hole on the base of the trough, the water will be all out in 21 minutes. If the cold water tap and the hot water tap are opened simultaneously with the opening of the hole, the trough will be full in 12.6 minutes. Then, how long does it take to full the trough when only the hot water tap is opened and the hole is closed?

Solution[edit]

Let the volume of the trough be liters. Also, let the rate of the cold water tap be liters per minute, the rate of the hot water tap be liters per minute, and the rate of the water leaving out of the hole be liters. With these variables and the rate formula, we can write three equations.

From the first two equations, and . Substitute these into the third equation and solve for .

It takes minutes for the trough to fill up when the hot water tap is opened and the hole is closed.

Problem[edit]

In how many ways can we change the sign with or , such that the following equation is true?

Solution[edit]

The sum of the numbers from to is , which is more than . That means the sum of the numbers that are being subtracted is .

To find out the possible ways to pick distinct numbers from to that add up to , we will use casework.

  • If the largest number being subtracted is , then the other number being subtracted is , for a total of possibility.
  • If the largest number being subtracted is , then the other number being subtracted is , for a total of possibility.
  • If the largest number being subtracted is , then the possible sets of numbers that are also being subtracted are and , for a total of possibilities.
  • If the largest number being subtracted is , then the possible sets of numbers that are also being subtracted are and , for a total of possibilities.
  • If the largest number being subtracted is , then the possible sets of numbers that are also being subtracted are and , for a total of possibilities.
  • If the largest number being subtracted is (or lower), there are no possibilities.

In total, there are ways to put plus and minus signs such that the equation would be true.

Problem[edit]

Solution[edit]

Let be the centers of circle and respectively. Also, let the tangent point of circles and be , let the tangent point of circles and be , let the tangent point of circles and be , and let the tangent point of circles and be . Finally, let be and respectively.


Note that are isosceles triangles, so degrees, degrees, degrees, and degrees. The sum of the angles in a line is so degrees and degrees.


That means degrees. Since is a quadrilateral, so Thus, all the tangent points of the four circles can be located in another circle.

Problem[edit]

A quadratic equation with integers and has roots which are positive integers. Prove that is not a prime.

Solution[edit]

Let and be the two positive roots of the quadratic. By Vieta's Formulas, Square both equations to get Add the two equations to get The right hand side can be factored into . Since , and , so can never be a prime since it can be written as the product of two integers greater than one.

Note that and are tangent points of the circle, so and Since , we know that is a square, so


Let , , and Since are tangent points to the incircle, we know that and Thus, Adding the three equations yields Thus, so the diameter of the incircle is .

Problem 8[edit]

A floor with an area of will be covered by rugs with various shapes, each having an area of . Show that there exist overlapping rugs with the overlapped area at least .

Solution[edit]

Let the first 3 rugs occupy the entire floor, then the next rug that you add in, by the pigeon hole principle, it must overlap with another rug. Let a, b and c be the overlapping region with rug 1, rug 2 and rug 3 respectively, a+b+c = 1, thus at least one of a, b and c must be greater than 0.2.
